oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Presbyterian Church, burnt, Sep 12th, 1848, circa 1859
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A page from a mounted and bound volume of twenty-five pen-and-ink wash drawings, and two pen-and-ink maps of Nashville created by William A. Eichbaum during the 1850s. Eichbaum was a Nashville bookseller and resident for fifty years. The drawing on this page is of the Presbyterian church that was destroyed by fire in 1848. This structure was located on the corner of present day Fifth Avenue and Church Street. The current Downtown Presbyterian Church was built in its place in 1849. Forms part of the William A. Eichbaum Sketchbook. 1 drawing : col. ; 5.75 x 9 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Eichbaum, William A., 1787-1873--Notebooks, sketchbooks, etc.
Downtown Presbyterian Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
